title: Newtons third law-forces between chain links

content.question: A rope is attached to two heavy chain links that are connected to each other, as shown. The rope is pulling the chain links up at a constant speed. The top chain link exerts a force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub T B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>TB</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> on the bottom link, and the bottom link exerts a force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub B T, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>BT</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> on the top link. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="F sub T B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>TB</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="F sub B T, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>BT</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub T B, end sub, is greater than F sub B T, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>TB</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>BT</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, because the chain links are moving upward.

<math alttext="F sub T B, end sub, is greater than F sub B T, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>TB</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>BT</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, because the rope only exerts a force on the top link.

<math alttext="F sub T B, end sub, equals F sub B T, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>TB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>BT</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, because the chain links are moving at a constant speed.

<math alttext="F sub T B, end sub, equals F sub B T, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>TB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>BT</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, because the chain links are an interacting Newton’s third law pair.

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub T B, end sub, equals F sub B T, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>TB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>BT</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, because the chain links are an interacting Newton’s third law pair.
